intro: Drymaria pattersonii, commonly known as the Paterson's mouse-ear, is a small annual herbaceous plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, white pubescence. Its flowers are typically pink or purple and are arranged in clusters at the tips of the stems. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as sandy soils and is often found in disturbed areas.
